Title: New payment transparency scheme to buoy small businesses - Minister
Description: More payments from big businesses to small ones will come on time under a new disclosure regime, the government says.

Title: My Food Bag chief executive resigns
Description: A note to the stock exchange said Kevin Bowler notified the company about his decision to step down from the meal kit delivery company last night.

Title: ANZ forecasts another three rate rises from Reserve Bank
Description: The economy's stubborn resilience is prompting the country's biggest bank to forecast even more aggressive interest rate rises from the Reserve Bank.

Title: NZ charged up to help electric aircraft take flight
Description: New Zealand is getting closely involved in developing commercial electric aircraft.

Title: Air New Zealand dismisses report of merger with Virgin Australia
Description: Air New Zealand is denying it is in merger talks after a report in The Australian newspaper.

Title: Manufacturing sector in expansion, data shows
Description: Manufacturing activity has improved to its best level in more than a year with a sharp increase in new orders.

Title: Majority of suburbs in main centres experience slide in property values
Description: The downturn in the housing market is being felt in most parts of the country with more than four out of five suburbs in each centre seeing values drop.

Title: Rising cost of groceries could drive unhealthy choices
Description: At many supermarkets tomatoes cost $15 a kg, potato chips are $1.50 - for many families, struggling with increased costs of living healthier choices are hard.

Title: Patagonia: Billionaire boss of fashion retailer gives company away
Description: The billionaire founder of the outdoor fashion retailer Patagonia says he has given away his company to a charitable trust.

Title: Grant Robertson strikes optimistic note at business breakfast, 'ensuring path back to surplus'
Description: The finance minister says there is an opportunity for the economy to thrive in the face of global challenges.

Title: GDP rises 1.7 percent, new figures show
Description: New Zealand's gross domestic product (GDP) rose 1.7 percent in the three months ending June after the surprise contraction in the first quarter, with the annual growth rate easing to 1 percent.

Title: Pushpay share price dips after report of buyout uncertainty
Description: Shares in payments company Pushpay have slumped after media speculation that a buyout deal from two of its shareholders is close to collapse.

Title: Shipping costs decline but not expected to return to pre-Covid levels
Description: Kiwibank says key indexes that track freight costs have fallen sharply over the past few months, with pressure on supply chains also easing.

Title: Air New Zealand's first shipment of sustainable aviation fuel set to arrive
Description: The shipment of 1.2 million litres of SAF was a drop in the bucket when compared with the 1.4 billion litres of fossil fuel the airline uses on an annual basis.

Title: Consumer NZ calls for airlines to front up over delays, disruptions
Description: Consumer NZ is campaigning for New Zealand airlines to be upfront about passengers' rights.

Title: Small businesses bearing brunt of labour shortages, rising costs
Description: Big business appears to be navigating the winds of economic change far better than small operators dealing with challenges on a number of fronts.

Title: NZ's first Costco announces opening date
Description: American supermarket giant Costco will open its doors in two weeks' time in West Auckland.

Title: Kawerau paper mill workers' union to consider pay offer
Description: After more than a month of being locked out of a Kawerau mill, Pulp and Paper Union members will today consider a pay offer which may see them return to work tomorrow.
